FuncDef:
The set transfer-mode command sets the transmission mode of the interface to LAN or WAN.
The undo set transfer-mode command restores the default transmission mode.
By default, the transmission mode of the interface is LAN.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the transmission mode of an interface is LAN.
-

Indicates that the transmission mode of an interface is WAN.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If transmission modes of interfaces at two ends of a link do not match (for example, one is in LAN mode and the other is in WAN mode), run the set transfer-mode command to configure one interface to work in the same transmission mode as the other to ensure reliable transmission.
Prerequisites
Before setting the transmission mode of a 10GE interface to LAN or WAN, delete the clock, PTP, and loopback configurations from the interface and run the shutdown command on the interface.
Precautions
The LAN/WAN mode of an interface cannot be changed if the interface has sub-interfaces or has been added to an Eth-Trunk interface.
